sen.j: 木梨軽皇子（きなしのかるのみこ）は第19代天皇であった允恭天皇の第一皇子、皇太子であった。
sen.e: Born as the first prince of the 19th imperial ruler, Emperor Ingyo, Kinashi no karunomiko was the crown prince.
Born as the first prince of the 19th imperial ruler, Emperor Ingyo, Kinashi no karu no miko was the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: Kinashi no karu no miko、Crown Princeとしました。
sen.e: Born as the first prince of the 19th imperial ruler, Emperor Ingyo, Kinashi no karu no miko was the Crown Prince.

sen.j: 母は皇后の忍坂大中姫（おしさかのおおなかつのひめのみこと）。
sen.e: His mother was Empress Oshisakano onakatsunohimeno mikoto.
His mother was Empress Oshisaka no onakatsunohime no mikoto.
sen.cmt: Oshisakano onakatsunohimeno mikoto→Oshisaka no onakatsunohime no mikotoとしました。
sen.e: His mother was Empress Oshisaka no onakatsunohime no mikoto.

sen.j: 同母弟に穴穂皇子（あなほのみこ、後の安康天皇）、大泊瀬稚武皇子（おおはつせのわかたけるのみこ、後の雄略天皇）など。
sen.e: His younger brothers-uterine included Anahono miko (later Emperor Anko) and Ohatsuseno wakatakeruno miko (later Emperor Yuryaku).
His younger brothers-uterine included Anaho no miko (later Emperor Anko) and Ohatsuse no wakatakeru no miko (later Emperor Yuryaku).
sen.cmt: Ahaho no miko、Ohatsuse no wakatakeru no mikoとしました。
sen.e: His younger brothers-uterine included Anaho no miko (later Emperor Anko) and Ohatsuse no wakatakeru no miko (later Emperor Yuryaku).

sen.j: 『古事記』によれば、允恭23年立太子する。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), Kinashi no karunomiko was formally installed as Crown Prince in A.D. 434.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), Kinashi no karu no miko was formally installed as Crown Prince in A.D. 434.
sen.cmt: the "Kojiki"、Kinashi no karu no mikoとしました。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), Kinashi no karu no miko was formally installed as Crown Prince in A.D. 434.

sen.j: しかし、同母妹である軽大娘皇女（かるのおおいらつめ）と情を通じた（近親相姦）それが原因となって允恭天皇の崩御後に失脚、伊予の国へ流される。
sen.e: But he had an (incestuous) affair with his younger sister-uterine Karuno oiratsume and as a result, he was overthrown after the demise of Emperor Ingyo, and was deported to Iyo Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But he had an (incestuous) affair with his younger sister-uterine Karu no oiratsume and as a result, he was overthrown after the demise of Emperor Ingyo, and was deported to Iyo Province.
But he had an (incestuous) affair with his younger sister-uterine Karu no oiratsume and as a result, he was overthrown after the demise of Emperor Ingyo, and was deported to Iyo Province.

sen.j: その後、あとを追ってきた軽大娘皇女と共に自害したと言われる。
sen.e: It is said that later, he committed joint suicide with Karuno oiratsume, who had followed him.
It is said that later, he committed joint suicide with Karu no oiratsume, who had followed him.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去、Karu no oiratsumeとしました。
sen.e: It is said that later, he committed joint suicide with Karu no oiratsume, who had followed him.
(Sotoorihime legend)
(Sotoorihime legend)
(Sotoorihime legend)

sen.j: 『日本書紀』では、情を通じた後の允恭24年に軽大娘皇女が伊予へ流刑となり、允恭天皇が崩御した允恭42年に穴穂皇子によって討たれたとある。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), it is Karuno oiratsume who was deported to Iyo Province in A.D. 435 after the incestuous affair with Kinashi no karunomiko, and he was forced to death by Anaho no miko in A.D. 453, the year when Emperor Ingyo demised.

According to the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), it is Karu no oiratsume who was deported to Iyo Province in A.D. 435 after the incestuous affair with Kinashi no karu no miko, and he was forced to death by Anaho no miko in A.D. 453, the year when Emperor Ingyo demised.
sen.cmt: the "Nihonshoki"とし、余分なスペース消去、Karu no oiratsume、Kinashi no karu no mikoとしました。
sen.e: According to the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), it is Karu no oiratsume who was deported to Iyo Province in A.D. 435 after the incestuous affair with Kinashi no karu no miko, and he was forced to death by Anaho no miko in A.D. 453, the year when Emperor Ingyo demised.
